column2: NEW HAMPSHIRE DMV PERMIT TEST
column6: NH

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. This road sign means:
column6: Intersection ahead
column8: Divided highway ahead
column10: You can travel in either direction in this lane

column2: 2. This sign tells drivers that:
column6: a divided highway is ahead.
column8: they must stop at the next intersection.
column10: left and right turns are not allowed.

column2: 3. A traffic sign with a red circle around and a slash over a symbol means:
column4: the maneuver shown on the sign should be executed with extreme caution.
column6: the maneuver shown by the symbol is not allowed.
column8: Do not drive faster than the posted speed limit.
column10: the maneuver shown on the sign can be executed only after coming to a complete stop.

column2: 4. When two cars arrive at an intersection with no signs or signals at the same time, which car has the right-of-way?
column4: The car approaching from the right.
column6: The car in which the driver sounds the horn.
column8: The car approaching from the left.
column10: The car that is traveling faster.

column2: 5. When driving near light rail vehicles, drivers should:
column4: expect trains on any track at any time.
column6: never drive around lowered crossing gates.
column8: always obey signs and traffic signals.

column2: 6. Your BAC depends on:
column6: the type of beverage you drink.
column8: the amount of alcohol you drink.

column2: 7. What is the slow moving vehicle symbol?
column6: A reflective orange triangle
column8: A reflective white triangle

column2: 8. Drive below the posted speed limit when:
column4: anything makes conditions less than perfect.
column6: you are on a four lane road.
column8: others drive below the speed limit.
column10: entering a highway where there are other cars.

column2: 9. You reach an intersection that is not controlled at the same time as a driver on your right, and both of you prepare to go straight. Who has the right-of-way?
column6: The other driver.
column8: No one.

column2: 10. If two vehicles arrive at a four-way stop at the same time:
column4: the vehicle on the left must yield to the vehicle on the right.
column6: the vehicle on the right must yield to the vehicle on the left.
column8: both vehicles must stop.
column10: the driver on the left must signal the driver on the right to go.

column2: 11. This sign means:
column4: Left turns in both directions of travel are not permitted.
column6: The center lane is shared for left turns.
column8: Vehicles may only turn left.

column2: 12. To practice defensive driving you should:
column4: look well ahead of your vehicle and be aware of developing traffic situations around you.
column6: maintain a proper following distance.
column8: always leave yourself a way out.

column2: 13. If another car has stopped in an adjacent lane in the same direction of travel, you should:
column4: tap your horn to let the other driver know you are passing.
column6: be careful in case the other vehicle has stopped for a pedestrian.
column8: speed up and pass the vehicle on the right.
column10: pass the car on the left.

column2: 14. If your turn signals fail, you should use _____ to indicate your intention to turn.
column6: hand signals
column8: your horn

column2: 15. When a school bus is stopped with its red lights flashing:
column4: drivers don't need to stop unless they are in a school zone.
column6: drivers may not pass while the red lights are flashing.
column8: you never need to stop.
column10: drivers only need to stop if children are present.

column2: 16. If you hear a thumping sound while driving, you should:
column6: get off the road and check your tires.
column8: try your emergency lights.
column10: hook your shoe under the gas pedal and see if you can free it.

column2: 17. What should you do if your headlights suddenly go out?
column4: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column6: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column8: Use your emergency lights, parking lights or directional signals.
column10: Brake immediately and activate your emergency lights.

column2: 18. This sign indicates the _______________ vehicles can safely travel in this area.
column6: reaction speed
column8: maximum speed

column2: 19. When driving behind a motorcycle, drivers must:
column4: drive on the shoulder beside the motorcycle.
column6: share the lane with the motorcycle.
column8: pass the motorcycle in the same lane.
column10: remembers that motorcyclists have the right to use a complete traffic lane.

column2: 20. A flashing yellow light:
column4: warns drivers to proceed with caution.
column6: can be found before reaching a sharp curve.
column8: is used at dangerous intersections.

column2: 21. This road sign means:
column6: No U-turns
column8: All traffic must turn right at the next intersection
column10: A left turn can be made only after stopping

column2: 22. It is illegal to drive below the speed limit:
column6: only in rural areas.
column8: when driving slowly disrupts the normal flow of traffic.

column2: 23. An inattentive driver:
column6: gazes at objects off the roadway while driving.
column8: carries on an eye-contact conversation with a passenger while driving.

column2: 24. At a stop sign there is no stop line or crosswalk. You must stop:
column6: after you enter the intersection, if you have a clear view of traffic on the intersecting roadway.
column8: at the next crosswalk.
column10: only if the traffic signal turns red.

column2: 25. A broken yellow line alongside a solid yellow line means:
column4: Passing is permitted on the side of the solid yellow line
column6: Passing on the right is permitted in either direction
column8: Passing is not permitted in either direction
column10: Passing is permitted on the side of the broken yellow line

column2: 26. Road signs that point out scenic areas and parks are:
column6: black and white.
column8: black and orange.

column2: 27. This sign indicates:
column6: Do not use your phone while driving
column8: Cell phone shop ahead

column2: 28. This road sign means:
column6: Limited parking
column8: One Way

column2: 29. When driving in winter, you should NOT:
column6: check your vehicle's antifreeze level and windshield washer fluid.
column8: drive on interstate roads.
column10: use snow tires on all four wheels of your vehicle.

column2: 30. This road sign means:
column6: One way
column8: Exit

column2: 31. You may not pass another vehicle on either side of a _______ centerline.
column6: solid or broken yellow
column8: double solid yellow

column2: 32. The traffic light is green and you want to drive straight through an intersection. If aÂ car is already in the intersection and is making a turn, you must:
column4: wait for the next green light.
column6: enter the intersection and then stop.
column8: drive through the intersection. You have the right-of-way.
column10: let that car complete its turn before you enter the intersection.

column2: 33. What is the first thing you should do if your wheels move off the pavement?
column4: Pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other drivers.
column6: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column8: Try pumping the gas pedal to increase pressure.

column2: 34. Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
column4: they can not safely return to the right lane before any oncoming vehicle comes within 200 feet of them.
column6: their lane has a solid yellow center line.
column8: they approach a curve on a two-way road and can not see around it.

column2: 35. This road sign means:
column6: Watch for vehicles entering from the side
column8: Divided highway ahead

column2: 36. When entering a highway from an entrance ramp, drivers should:
column4: enter slowly to avoid other vehicles.
column6: stop first, then gradually enter traffic.
column8: accelerate to the speed of traffic.
column10: drive above the speed of traffic to get ahead.

column2: 37. When you get in a car to drive, the first thing you should do is:
column6: adjustÂ the steering wheel.
column8: adjust your seat belt.

column2: 38. This sign means:
column4: The divided highway on which drivers are traveling ends ahead.
column6: A road crosses the main highway ahead.
column8: Drivers are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.

column2: 39. Alcohol:
column6: enhances your ability to see clearly.
column8: makes it easier to make correct decisions.
column10: makes you less aware of what is happening to your driving abilities.

column2: 40. WhenÂ changing lanesÂ on an interstate, drivers should:
column6: use cruise control to increase traction whenever possible.
column8: stop in the breakdown lane if they are tired.
column10: signal and check mirrors and blind spots.
